noun.description: A triangle of railroad track used for turning locomotives or trains.
(in plumbing) a short pipe with a branch joining it at an acute angle.

proper noun.description: A river that rises in the mountains of western Wales and flows southeast for about 132 miles (208 km) before entering the Severn estuary at Chepstow. In its lower reaches it forms part of the border between Wales and England.

origin: Mid 19th century: the letter Y represented as a word.
